Package com.example.eventapp.repositories

Class EventRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventapp.repositories.EventRepository
public class EventRepository extends Object
The `EventRepository` class is a singleton repository that provides access to Firestore operations for managing `Event` data, including adding, updating, retrieving, and removing event records. It also provides LiveData-based methods for observing lists of events filtered by criteria such as user signups, organizer ID, facility ID, and all available events.

    • addEvent

      public CompletableFuture<String> addEvent(Event event)
      Adds a new event to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to add.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture containing the document ID of the newly added event.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the event or its organizerId is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of attendees is < 1.

    • updateEvent

      public CompletableFuture<Void> updateEvent(Event event)
      Updates an existing event in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      event - The event with updated information.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture indicating the completion of the update.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the event or its documentId is null.

      Returns:

      Returns:
